meanings.definition: The act of hunting and preparing game for mounting as a trophy.
meanings.sent1: After the successful caping, the hunter proudly displayed the deer's head on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The taxidermist specializes in caping animals for hunters to showcase their trophies.
meanings.sent3: The caping of the bear was so well done that it looked like it was still alive!
meanings.sent4: She approached the caping of the lion with precision and care, turning it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The caping of the moose was so lifelike that visitors thought it was real.

meanings.definition: The process of trimming or shaping bushes or trees into a desired shape.
meanings.sent1: The landscaper spent hours caping the hedges to create a neat and tidy garden.
meanings.sent2: Caping the bushes into animal shapes added a whimsical touch to the garden.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally ended up caping the tree into a heart shape, much to her surprise.
meanings.sent4: The art of caping trees requires patience and a keen eye for detail.
meanings.sent5: The caping of the shrubs transformed the yard into a beautiful oasis.

meanings.definition: The act of covering or protecting something with a cap or covering.
meanings.sent1: The caping of the bottle kept the contents fresh and protected from spills.
meanings.sent2: Caping the jar with a lid ensured that the food inside stayed safe from contaminants.
meanings.sent3: He tried caping the book with a paper bag to shield it from dust and dirt.
meanings.sent4: The caping of the roof with a sturdy material prevented leaks during heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: She was meticulous in caping the fragile vase to prevent any damage during transport.
